exam_name: TOEFL - Test of English as Foreign Language

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
What is TOEFL exam? The TOEFL test is a standardised English language proficiency test that assesses the English language skills of candidates who wish to study abroad. The TOEFL full form is the Test of English as Foreign Language. The TOEFL exam is administered by the Educational Testing Service (ETS) and is held using the computer-based TOEFL iBT format. The alternative paper-delivered method can only be used in locations lacking an internet connection. TOEFL exam syllabus generally measures the four communication skills - reading, listening, speaking, and writing to enroll international students.

The TOEFL exam is approved for employment and immigration purposes and for entrance to more than 11,000 colleges and institutions in 150 different countries. Top countries like the USA, UK, Canada, and Australia use TOEFL scores to evaluate the English language proficiency of international students. The computer-based ETS TOEFL is administered more than 60 times annually and can be taken at designated testing centres. The TOEFL exam dates are available throughout the year at various test centres across the country. The candidates can check availability of the TOEFL exam dates 2024 before registering for the proficiency test on the official website of ETS. 

After the TOEFL test dates, the score achieved is valid for two years. TOEFL 2024 registration is around the clock. Furthermore, bear in mind that there are no prerequisites for taking the TOEFL Essentials Test; rather, candidates must achieve the minimal TOEFL score requirements, both sectional and overall, established by the school to which they are applying. The TOEFL exam fee in India is USD 205 (Rs. 17,140 approx.) for the iBT test and USD 120 (Rs. 10,030 approx.) for the TOEFL Essential. Candidates can register for the TOEFL exam through the ETS official website.

TOEFL Exam: Latest Updates

 The ETS has also announced the following changes:

  • As per the latest updates from the ETS, Indian TOEFL test takers can now get specially curated TOEFL books free of cost. These materials will include full-length practice tests with answer keys, sample responses, access to audio files, and information on test content and scoring. Test takers can also have access to a self-paced learning platform called TOEFL TestReady for further learning opportunities. 
  • From July 2023, ETS TOEFL registration is simplified, and test takers can register on the website and apply for the TOEFL exam easily.
  • ETS discontinued the TOEFL Paper Based Test on January 20, 2024.
  • On May 6, 2024, ETS announced that TOEFL scores for exams taken on or after May 5, 2024, will be considered valid for the Australia visa purpose. Earlier, scores of the TOEFL exam were under review by the Australian Department of Home Affairs (DHA) in July, and the scores were no longer accepted.
  • The TOEFL exam duration has been reduced to less than two hours from three hours. However, this does not apply to the paper-based test.
  • The TOEFL iBT preparation materials will be updated in tune with these changes.
  • In addition to this, streamlined instructions and navigation will assist the candidates throughout the test.
  • The TOEFL reading section has been cut short for the candidates.
  • All unscored TOEFL questions will be removed.
  • More transparency will be exercised in revealing the TOEFL score available from July 26, onwards.
  • ETS has launched a new app called the TOEFL Go! Candidates can prepare for the latest version of the TOEFL iBT test anytime, anywhere on TOEFL Go! TOEFL application. As part of ETS's commitment to improving the TOEFL iBT test-taking experience, access to the app will be completely free for test takers.
  • With the launch of TOEFL Go!, test takers can expect digital practice and performance feedback in all four sections: Reading, Listening, Speaking, and Writing.
  • Local payment options will be introduced to facilitate the convenience of the candidates in payment of the TOEFL exam fees.
  • A customer service centre will be made available for the candidates soon, which will be operational for all seven days of the week for 12 hours a day.

TOEFL Full Form

TOEFL full form is the Test of English as Foreign Language. It is an international English language testing system. TOEFL 2024 is mainly developed for students from non-English speaking countries who want to study in English-speaking countries. Achieving a minimum level of English proficiency is decided in TOEFL by the scores attained by test takers. Based on that, universities offer admissions.

Types of TOEFL tests

Candidates should note that the TOEFL test is administered in three formats, ie. TOEFL iBT (Internet-based test), TOEFL Essential and TOEFL Home Edition. From January 20, 2024, TOEFL Paper Bases Test has been discontinued. TOEFL iBT is the preferred test format and accounts for more than 98% of TOEFL tests worldwide.  The TOEFL Home Edition is the TOEFL iBT test conducted at home with a proctor monitoring for the duration of the TOEFL test.

TOEFL iBT:  This is an online version of the TOEFL test 2024 and is the most popular version of TOEFL due to its ease of use and less resource usage. TOEFL iBT test centres are present in major cities of most countries.

TOEFL iBT Home-Edition: This edition is an at home TOEFL exam given at the comfort of your home. However, the exam is supervised by a human proctor. Make sure to fulfil the exam room requirements for this type of TOEFL exam.

TOEFL Essential: The TOEFL Essential test will be an at-home exam. The student-friendly test format will include questions on the academic and everyday life scenarios. The test will be conducted at home and supervised by an online proctor.

TOEFL Exam Scholarships

There are various types of TOEFL exam scholarships, namely: 

  • TOEFL Grants include the English-Language Researcher/Practitioner Grant Program, Small Grants for Doctoral Research in Second or Foreign Language Assessment, the TOEFL Committee of Examiners 2024, and the TOEFL Young Students Series Research Programme. 
  • TOEFL Awards include Jacqueline Ross's TOEFL Dissertation Award.
  • TOEFL Awards by Nomination
  • TOEFL Award by TESOL

highlights.value: Test of English as Foreign Language

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
ETS TOEFL exam has no specified eligibility criteria. Any candidate who is a non-native English speaker can apply for the TOEFL test irrespective of age, gender, and nationality. The applicant must therefore obtain the minimum sectional or total scores on the TOEFL exam 2024 that are needed by the institute for which they are requesting admission. Please note that the minimum TOEFL exam eligibility criteria may vary amongst universities.

The eligibility criteria for TOEFL exam to appear for the test are mentioned below.

  • Age: The TOEFL conducting body, ETS has set no specific eligibility criteria for the test takers. Applicants of 15 years or below, must be accompanied by parents or guardians during the test.
  • Education: Applicants who wish to pursue higher education in English-speaking nations must complete their 10+2 before taking the TOEFL test.
  • ID Requirements: Interested applicants must have a valid passport to take the TOEFL test.

application_process.html_content:
Students can apply for the TOEFL 2024 in four ways: Using an ETS login account, TOEFLGo Mobile App, through a call, or by mail.

Online ETS registration for TOEFL is the most preferred way because it is the quickest and most practical way for TOEFL registration. The TOEFL 2024 exam registration period is open every day of the week, 24 hours a day.

TOEFL Exam Registration Online

The procedures for signing up for the TOEFL iBT Test are as follows.

Step 1: Step one of ETS registration TOEFL is to create an ETS TOEFL application account.

  1. Students can create a candidate account by giving personal information such as their name, birth date, and gender on the TOEFL login page.

  2. Then, include your home and mobile phone numbers along with a valid email account for correspondence. The applicant will also need to set up an account by entering a username and password.

Step 2: Choose a TOEFL test site and a TOEFL exam date 2024 in step two.

  1. The TOEFL exam will be administered more than 60 times annually at designated testing centres. To choose a convenient test date and test location, click the TEST CENTRE search bar.

  2. Select a 2-month window after picking a location to take the TOEFL iBT test, to choose TOEFL exam dates.

  3. The two-month period may include any consecutive two months (say, January - February, February - March, March - April, etc.)

  4. Based on the choices made, a list of possible TOEFL exam 2024 dates and related test centres will be displayed on the screen.

  5. To check if there are any seats available in the chosen TOEFL exam 2024 dates, click the "Show Test Times and Register" link next to the testing facility.

  6. Select a testing site, and

Step 3: Complete the TOEFL exam registration 2024 by paying the test fee in India.

Decide who or what organisation will receive your TOEFL score available. Up to four universities may be selected for free, except for the exam fee. But to add more institutes, a fee of USD 20 that is around Rs. 1,670 per institute has to be paid along with TOEFL fees in India.

TOEFL Exam Registration 2024: By Phone

To take the TOEFL iBT in an exam centre located in the US, U.S. Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, or Canada, call +1-443-751-4862 or 1-800-GO-TOEFL (1-800-468-6335).

For any other location, the applicant has to call the Regional Registration Centre (RRC). 

TOEFL Exam Registration 2024: By Mail 

  1. Download the TOEFL Registration Form.

  2. Fill out the TOEFL exam form using Black/Blue pen ink.

  3. Choose a payment method from the available options for TOEFL fees in India.

  4. Send the completed TOEFL application 2024 form along with payment receipts to the address mentioned on the form or to the Regional Registration Centre.

  5. Completed TOEFL application must reach the admission office at least four weeks before the TOEFL test dates.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Check the latest TOEFL exam syllabus before embarking on the test preparation. In order to ensure comprehensive preparation for the TOEFL, one may refer to the following TOEFL exam preparation tips 2024 in mind:

TOEFL 2024 Preparation for Listening 

  • To gain a sense of the English language, pronunciation, voice fluctuation, accents, and enunciation, listen to radio, TV, and online English broadcasts.

  • While participating in the listening activities, make a list of any prospective talking points and practice your questions.

TOEFL Preparation for Speaking 

  • When you are listening to a program, make it a habit to speak after or in addition to it.

  • Learn to argue your point firmly, convincingly, and without hesitation.

  • You can practice speaking in a timed environment by watching the official ETS Speaking practice videos on the TOEFL iBT YouTube channel.

TOEFL Preparation for Reading 2024

  • Practice reading questions in a timed environment.

  • Develop your vocabulary. One way to do that is to read a lot, whether it's novels with favourable ratings, newspaper editorials, journals, etc.

TOEFL 2024 Preparation for Writing 

  • Practice writing in a timed setting about relevant subjects.

  • Be sure you possess a good command of grammar, sentence structure, and the appropriate language before writing your remarks or expressing your opinions.

TOEFL Exam Day Tips:

  • Bring two types of valid identity proofs in case the examiner disregards one of the proofs. You should have a backup ID.  
  • Don't bring your personal belongings.
  • Ensure you arrive at the test centre at least 30 minutes before your test time.
  • Start preparation as early as possible to cover the entire TOEFL exam syllabus.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
Knowing the TOEFL full exam format is the first step for test takers. The most common and commonly used TOEFL exam by institutions is the computer-based iBT version. The less prevalent paper-delivered test is only provided in areas where internet testing is not an option. TOEFL exam pattern 2024 of the new TOEFL exam syllabus is explained below:

  1. Mode of exam: The TOEFL test is administered in computer-based mode, known as the TOEFL iBT Test. Whereas, TOEFL Essentials is an at home exam of 1.5 hours.

  2. Sections: Four sections: TOEFL reading, TOEFL writing, TOEFL speaking, and TOEFL listening. 

  3. Duration: Approximately 3 hours, with each section to be allotted a fixed time. 

  4. Break: There is a 10-minute break after the reading and listening section.

TOEFL iBT Test Structure (for tests starting July 26)

TOEFL Exam Pattern 2024

ETS, the conducting body of TOEFL, has implemented a new TOEFL pattern from July 26, 2023. It is an enhanced version of the test to improve the efficiency of test takers and make the exam procedure hassle-free. The TOEFL exam duration for individual sections has been reduced. However, the total marks of the TOEFL test remain the same at 120 in the new TOEFL test pattern.

faqs.question: Can I give TOEFL Paper Based Test?
faqs.answer: ETS has officially discontinued the TOEFL Paper-Based Test from January 20, 2024. Currently, there are 3 types of TOEFL test formats, namely: TOEFL iBT, TOEFL iBT Home Based Test, and TOEFL Essential.  Apart from TOEFL iBT, TOEFL iBT Home Based and TOEFL Essential give the applicant the opportunity to give the TOEFL exam from the comfort of their homes. However, the applicants must meet the relevant test room requirements prior to the exam.

faqs.question: What is the cost of TOEFL exam in India?
faqs.answer: The cost of the TOEFL exam in India is around Rs. 17,140 (USD 205). The TOEFL fee for the Essential Test is around Rs. 10,030 (USD 120). A few additional charges may apply for exam cancellation, rescheduling, and late registration.

faqs.question: What is the TOEFL exam for?
faqs.answer: TOEFL is a standardised test used by foreign universities to measure the English language proficiency of students who are planning to study abroad. Many study abroad universities like Harvard, Stanford, MIT, and others accept TOEFL scores to assess the English language skills of the students for top courses.

faqs.question: How many marks is for the TOEFL exam?
faqs.answer: Scores can vary from 0 to 120. The Speaking and Writing portion responses are scored using a combination of AI scoring and ETS-certified raters. The time it takes to send findings varies depending on how the test was administered and how recipients are informed of the results.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for the TOEFL?
faqs.answer: The TOEFL exam has no set requirements according to the ETS, who is the official TOEFL conducting body. However, if you are 15 years or younger, you would be required parental consent.

faqs.question: Which countries accept TOEFL?
faqs.answer: TOEFL is accepted by over 150 countries, including the US, UK, Australia, New Zealand, France, Germany, and Canada.

faqs.question: Is TOEFL easier than IELTS?
faqs.answer: Which exam is easier between IELTS and TOEFL is completely subjective. It is thought that the reading component of IELTS is simpler than the TOEFL reading section. Compared to the IELTS essay's word limit of 250 words, the TOEFL essay is longer at 300 words. As a result, you need to prepare even more for the TOEFL reading section.

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
GRE is a standardised entrance test used for admission to different business and law school programs across the world. Indian students planning to pursue higher education in countries like US, UK, and Canada must attempt the GRE exam as part of their admission process. GRE test is accepted by almost 94 countries and thousands of universities across the world for graduate admission purposes. 

The GRE full form is Graduate Record Examinations. The GRE test is conducted by ETS (Educational Testing Service). GRE has no specific age criteria, both students and working professionals can attempt this test irrespective of their age, gender, and nationality. GRE measures a candidate's verbal and quantitative reasoning, critical thinking, and analytical writing skills. The skills tested in the GRE test are not limited to any particular field of study but can be useful to pursue any course. 

Note: From September 22, 2023, the shorter version of the GRE has been introduced. This new version of the GRE test is only two (2) hours. The GRE exam dates are available all around the year. Candidates can register online for the GRE at any time at their convenience 

GRE full form 

The full form of  GRE examination is the "Graduate Record Examination". This GRE full-form question is searched by thousands of students every year with the intent to apply for it. The Educational Testing Service also called ETS is the administrator of GRE exam. Registration for the GRE can be done conveniently online at home or by phone or mail. Candidates can now attempt the GRE General test at its authorised GRE test centres or from their homes according to their convenience

GRE score is accepted by thousands of foreign universities including Stanford University, the University of Virginia, MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology), Dartmouth College, University of California. However, the range of GRE cutoff may differ depending on the academic curricula o the university. 

What are the types of GRE exams?

There are two (2) types of GRE exams 

  • GRE General test

  • GRE Subject test. 

The GRE General test can be taken by candidates who are interested in admission to graduation, business, and law school programs. This GRE exam measures skills like verbal and quantitative reasoning and critical thinking. Many universities require the GRE as an admission requirement. Students can even showcase GRE test scores to institutions that do not require the GRE as an additional record of their candidate's profile. 

The GRE Subject test can be taken by the candidates to measure their skill in a particular field of study like Physics, Maths Psychology, etc. These subject-type GRE test scores are submitted for admissions or scholarship purposes as an additional element in the candidate's qualifications. Students who completed their undergraduate degree can attempt the GRE subject test to showcase their extensive interest and merit in the respective subject.

GRE Exam Dates July 2024

Latest Updates for GRE exam

ETS has released the shorter version of GRE exam from September 22, 2023. The time duration for the test has been reduced to 1 hour 58 minutes, and GRE test dates are available throughout the year. GRE is widely accepted for all graduate and professional courses across the world. The shorter version of the GRE General Test has fewer Verbal Reasoning and Quantitative Reasoning questions and only one Analytical Writing essay, helping reduce test-taking fatigue.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
There are no specific GRE eligibility criteria mentioned by the ETS to attempt the GRE exam. Candidates interested in taking the graduation courses, business and law school programs can attempt the GRE 2024 without any restrictions on gender, race, background, nationality etc. 

As there is no GRE exam eligibility, candidates are advised to check the course and college eligibility requirements. GRE is an entrance exam to many master's courses. Generally to attempt the GRE for master's candidates need to complete graduation in the relevant UG courses. Similarly, students applying for the GRE for MBA admissions must hold a minimum UG degree and some years of experience as demanded by the B-Schools.

Candidates can check the below conditions which meet the basic GRE exam qualification.

  • Age Limit for GRE: There is no age limit set by ETS to attempt the GRE exam. Usually GRE is given by candidates who have already completed their bachelor's and planning to appear for a master's. However, students who are below 15 years of age need to be accompanied by parents or guardians of at least 18 years or older. 

  • Education Qualification: There is no minimum educational qualification officially set by ETS. Usually, students who have completed or studying bachelor's degree apply for the GRE. As many master's courses require GRE scores, students shall complete a relevant UG degree to seek a master's. Generally, students appear for the exam after completing their undergraduate or while they are in their final year.

  • ID requirements:  Indian students need a valid passport to attempt the GRE at the test centre or at home.

application_process.html_content:
The process for the GRE registration can be done through ways like online, phone, mail, and fax. Candidates can register for the GRE online at the official GRE website. Candidates are advised to check the available GRE exam dates before registering for the exam. Here is the online GRE registration process mentioned below.

Step 1: Visit the official GRE ETS website and create your account. 

Step 2: Choose the type and mode of the GRE exam like home or test centre versions. If it is a test centre, choose country, city, and centre. The next step would be mentioning the GRE exam dates and times.

Step 3:  Enter the personal and academic details.

Step 4: Finally, pay the GRE exam fees and complete the registration.

How to register for GRE Exam: At-Home Test?

  • The process for GRE home-based test registration is the same as the test centre version, except for the choice of the test centre. 
  • Candidates need to have the requisite equipment like a computer, compatible specified browsers, and an internet connection to attempt the GRE home version
  • The GRE at-home test is monitored by a human proctor online through ProctorU. At-home testing is available around the clock, 7 days a week.

What are the IDs required for GRE registration?

The ID required for the GRE exam depends on the test region and country of citizenship. For home-proctored GRE exams, candidates are required to present a valid government-issued ID.

For Indians the acceptable ID is a passport with few exceptions, all Indian ID documents must meet the following requirements during GRE exam applications.

Note: Any electronic ID issued to a mobile phone or any other electronic device is not acceptable. If the above conditions are not met by the ID submitted for the GRE, the application is liable to be rejected. 

Checklist for GRE Registration

  • Keep relevant ID ready.

  • Check out the fee for GRE exam registration.

  • Also, check the availability of the test slot if taking the GRE test in one of the authorised GRE test centres.

  • Pick the date for the GRE such that there is ample time to submit the scores to the colleges applying.

  • Keep a check on the availability of the exam centres for the GRE.

GRE Test Pattern 2024

The GRE is a computer-based adaptive test. In the General GRE exam pattern, the candidate has the flexibility to skip the questions and come back later. The GRE General has 3 sections. The verbal and quantitative reasoning sections of the GRE 2024 have 2 subsections for each. The first subsections of each have questions of average difficulty level whereas the second subsection's difficulty depends on the performance of the candidate.

units.topics_html:
• Operations with exponents; factoring and simplifying algebraic expressions; relations, functions, equations and inequalities; solving linear and quadratic equations and inequalities; solving simultaneous equations and inequalities
  • Setting up equations to solve word problems; and coordinate geometry, including graphs of functions, equations and inequalities, intercepts and slopes of lines

• Operations with exponents; factoring and simplifying algebraic expressions; relations, functions, equations and inequalities; solving linear and quadratic equations and inequalities; solving simultaneous equations and inequalities
  • Setting up equations to solve word problems; and coordinate geometry, including graphs of functions, equations and inequalities, intercepts and slopes of lines

• Parallel and perpendicular lines, circles, triangles-including isosceles, equilateral and 30°-60°-90° triangles-quadrilaterals, other polygons, congruent and similar figures, three-dimensional figures, area, perimeter, volume
  • The Pythagorean theorem and angle measurement in degrees

• Basic descriptive statistics, such as mean, median, mode, range, standard deviation, interquartile range, quartiles and percentiles
  • Interpretation of data in tables and graphs, such as line graphs, bar graphs, circle graphs, boxplots, scatterplots and frequency distributions; elementary probability, such as probabilities of compound events and independent events
  • Conditional probability; random variables and probability distributions, including normal distributions; and counting methods, such as combinations, permutations and Venn diagrams

  • Language: (i) Units (phonemes, morphemes, phrases), (ii) syntax, (iii) meaning, (iv) speech perception and processing, (v) reading processes, (vi) verbal and nonverbal communication, (vii) bilingualism, (viii) theories, applications and issues
  • Memory: (i) Working memory, (ii) long-term memory, (iii) types of memory, (iv) memory systems and processes, (v) theories, applications and issues
  • Thinking: (i) Representation (categorization, imagery, schemas, scripts), (ii) problem solving, (iii) judgment and decision-making processes, (iv) planning, metacognition, (v) intelligence, (vi) theories, applications and issues

faqs.question: Is the GRE mandatory for Northwest Missouri State University?
faqs.answer: Northwest Missouri State University has set different eligibility requirements as per the level of programmes. The GRE (Graduate Record Examination) scores are mandatory for securing admission to the university; the minimum score for the GRE should be no less than 280. The selection process also required many other additional documents from international applicants.

faqs.question: Is GRE mandatory for Wichita State University?
faqs.answer: Applicants are required to submit their general GRE scores and TOEFL scores (for non-native speakers of English). The graduate school requires you to submit scores on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) directly to the office by the examining agency.

faqs.question: Is GRE a hard exam?
faqs.answer: The test hardness can vary from one candidate to another. When compared to the other entrance tests like LSAT or MCAT, the GRE is considered to be easier. However, with the best preparation and schedule, candidates can improve their performance for the GRE exam.

faqs.question: What is the GRE exam used for?
faqs.answer: The full form of GRE is the Graduate Record Examination. It is a standardized test used for admissions to various graduate programs and business schools worldwide. For tailored advice on GRE preparation and how it fits into your academic goals, consider reaching out to Invicta Career Consultancy, known for its expertise in guiding students through standardized test preparation and the study abroad process, While there are other options available, hence you can pay a visit to their website (icclearning.com) and get consult with them for better guidance. All the best to you.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for GRE exam?
faqs.answer: There is no specific eligibility set by the ETS for the GRE 2024. So candidates irrelevant of their age, or educational background can attempt the GRE test. Usually, students who completed studying bachelors attempt the GRE to seek masters admission.

faqs.question: Is there any negative marking in the GRE exam?
faqs.answer: There is no negative marking on the GRE test. Candidates are free to guess and attempt the question the question in the GRE. The scoring for the question depends on the difficulty level of the section and the number of correct answers given by the test taker.

faqs.question: What is the cost of GRE exam?
faqs.answer: The price of the GRE exam varies according to the test type. The GRE cost for the General test type in India is INR 22,550. Whereas the GRE fee for the subject test type in India is INR 14, 500.

faqs.question: Can I apply for the GRE test?
faqs.answer: Any candidate who is planning to apply for admission in PG courses, law school, business school programs, etc., can apply for the GRE exam. There is no specific GRE eligibility mentioned by the exam conducting body. So candidates irrespective of their age, education, gender, etc., can apply for the GRE.

faqs.question: What is GRE?
faqs.answer: GRE is an entrance test attempted by candidates to seek admission in a university or college for higher education. Most of the Indian students who are applying for master's, law schools or business school programs at abroad attempt the test for admission purposes. The test measures the knowledge and thinking ability of the candidate like verbal and quantitative reasoning skills and analytical writing skills.

exam_name: PTE Academic - Pearson Test of English Academic

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
What is PTE? The PTE is an internationally recognised English language proficiency examination conducted by the Pearson VUE.  The PTE exam's full form is Pearson Test of English. PTE is trusted by over 3,500 universities and colleges globally for admission to various courses. Pearson test is a computer-based test used to assess the English proficiency of non-native English speakers who want to pursue higher education abroad. The PTE Academic tests language proficiency in real-world situations. 

The PTE Academic score is recognised for admission to many universities in Australia, Canada, New Zealand, UK, and USA. Reputed universities, including Harvard University, Yale University, and INSEAD accept PTE Academic scores to enrol international students. PTE test is also accepted for visa applications to Australia, Canada, New Zealand, and the UK. In addition to being accepted as proof of English language proficiency, PTE is also accepted by ministries of education and employers in many countries. PTE Academic is also recognised by the US State Boards of Nursing for work visas.

The PTE exam pattern consists of only 3 sections: Speaking & Writing, Listening, and Reading. The total PTE exam duration is 2 hours. PTE is a fully computer-based test conducted in a test centre. The speaking and writing sections are conducted together. The PTE registration can be done online from its official website throughout the year. Students can complete their test registration by paying the necessary PTE exam fee. The PTE academic test fee in India is Rs. 17,000. The PTE Academic result is released within just 48 hours from the exam date and is valid for two years. During this period, candidates can send the scores to as many universities as they wish to. The conducting body does not charge any additional fees for sharing the scores with institutions.

PTE Exam Latest Update 

PTE Core: A new type of PTE test for people who are willing to migrate or work in Canada. The PTE Core is very similar to the PTE Academic, assessing the four (4) skills in English. Here, the key difference is that PTE Core involves real-life and non-academic focus concepts. Candidates using PTE core can apply for Canada permanent residency. 

Types of PTE Exam

The PTE exam is offered in four types: PTE Academic, PTE Core,  PTE UK Visa Tests, and PTE Academic Online. Which PTE exam to take completely depends on the individual's goals and preferences. 

What is PTE Academic Exam?

It is a computer-based English test that assesses the English language proficiency of the students in three main sections: speaking & writing, reading, and listening skills. The duration of PTE Academic is around 135 minutes. Students who are looking to study in top universities abroad can take the PTE Academic test to demonstrate their English language skills. 

What is PTE Core Exam?

PTE Core is a computer-based language proficiency test that evaluates the English language skills of students in three academic levels: speaking & writing, reading, and listening skills. Candidates who are applying for a permanent residency in Canada can take the PTE Core exam.

What is PTE UK Visa Tests? 

Candidates who wish to apply for a Student route visa (formerly known as the Tier 4 General student visa) can apply for the PTE UKVI test. This visa allows students to study for below degree levels such as foundation, pathways, or professional English courses. There are no major differences between PTE UKVI and Academic tests. A few minor differences in choosing the PTE UKVI against Academic is that PTE Academic UKVI  provides a Unique Reference Number (URN) for UK visa application. 

What is PTE Academic Online?

It is an at-home version of PTE Academic exam. The test content, scoring, and format of the PTE Academic Online is similar to the Academic version. Students who are unable to visit the PTE test centre can take the test online in a quiet and private space. Currently, PTE Academic Online is not accepted for visa applications for most foreign universities. 

Requirements for PTE Academic Online

  • A Windows or Mac laptop or desktop computer
  • Good internet connection
  • A wired headset with a microphone
  • A quiet and private location

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates who are appearing for the PTE should check the PTE eligibility criteria. The conducting body has no specific PTE eligibility criteria for its test-takers. However, students need to check the eligibility requirements for the university or organisation they are applying to. Here are some of the basic PTE exam eligibility criteria for international students.

  • PTE Age Requirements: The candidate must be at least 16 years of age. If the candidate is under 18 years of age, then he or she must submit proof of parental consent in order to be eligible to sit for the examination. There is no bar on the maximum age requirement.
  • PTE Academic Requirements: Students who have completed their secondary education can easily take the PTE examination.
  • Students with Disabilities: For students with disabilities, accommodations are provided by the Pearson PTE authority. However, students must apply for the arrangements in advance to guarantee that various amenities are available.
  • Number of Attempts: There is no restriction on the number of attempts for the PTE test.
  • PTE Eligibility for Identification: Aspirants must provide appropriate documents to validate their identification.
  • Institution or Employer Requirements: Students must check the eligibility requirements of the institutes they are applying to as the PTE score requirements may vary for each institution.

application_process.html_content:
To apply for the PTE Academic  examination, a candidate must register for a Pearson VUE account on the official website through the following procedure:

How to register for the Pearson PTE exam?

Here's a step-by-step guide on how to register for the PTE test:

Step 1: Visit the official PTE login website.

Step 2: Agree to the PTE Terms and Conditions to move to the next step.

Step 3: Click on 'Book a test' to choose PTE test centre, date, and time.

Step 4: Click on "Start" on the PTE application form.

Step 5: Enter all the necessary information to set up an online PTE Academic account. Click "Next" after filling out the PTE application form.

Step 6: Provide a legal name as per your ID. Remember in case the name doesn't match the ID, the candidate will be exempted from the test.  

Step 7: Read the policies mentioned on the Pearson website and pay the necessary PTE test fees. Payment can be made through internet banking. Make sure to keep your payment receipt for future reference.

Step 8: Pearson will confirm your account by email within 48 hours after your application submission.

Step 9: Use your registration details to log in to your Pearson account to schedule your PTE exam date, modify your appointment schedule, and update your personal information.

Candidates are advised to take a printout of the acknowledgement receipt for future reference. 

PTE Test Fees

The PTE exam fees in India is Rs 17,000 inclusive of 18% sales tax. The PTE exam fee 2024 for both the PTE Academic and PTE Academic online is the same. The details of PTE test fees for various PTE tests are mentioned below.

preparation_tips.html_content:
In order to prepare properly for the PTE Academic 2024 exam, candidates must keep the following points in mind to score well on the PTE and ensure a high level of English language proficiency:

Preparation for PTE Academic Speaking & Writing:

  • Practice essay writing on various topics in a timed environment.
  • Always stay within the prescribed word limit for the specific writing exercise, i.e., under 100 words for the summarising the test exercise and under 500 words for the essay.
  • Avoid redundancy and use unequivocal sentence structure and vocabulary. 
  • Ensure that the enunciation of words is clear and avoid hesitancy.
  • Do not hurry through the speaking exercises; maintain a steady oratory pace despite the time constraints.
  • Do not spend time correcting oratory mistakes; carry on with the exercise regardless of botched words.
  • Practice speaking aloud at home with various questions and exercises in a timed environment. 

Preparation for PTE Academic Reading:

  • Manage time properly during reading exercises as the number of questions is greater than in other sections.
  • Read and re-read each question before attempting to answer without giving in to overconfidence.
  • Practice as many sample questions as possible.

Preparation for PTE Academic  Listening:

  • Practice listening section questions from audio exercises in a timed environment.
  • Maintain calm composure and listen patiently to the audio being played.
  • Take notes of every potential point of information to ensure clarity while answering questions.

PTE Preparation Books

You can opt for the self-study route to prepare for the PTE Academic by referring to some of the comprehensive books available. These include:

  • The Official Guide to PTE Academic
  • Expert PTE Academic course book B1 and B2
  • Wiley's PTE Advantage for the Academic Module

Also Read: 

  • PTE Academic Preparation Tips and Tricks PDF
  • PTE Academic exam guide

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The PTE Academic test comprises 3 different sections or parameters upon which the candidate’s proficiency in English is evaluated. These include: Reading, Listening, and Speaking & Writing. The duration of PTE exam is around 135 minutes for all test formats. 

PTE Academic 2024 Exam Pattern 

PTE Sections

Question types

Duration

Speaking & Writing

7 different question types

54–67 min

Reading

5 different question types

29–30 min

Listening

8 different question types based on video and audio clips

30–43 min

PTE Test Format: Sections and Question Types

As mentioned above, PTE test pattern is comprised of 3 sections: Reading, Listening, and Speaking & Writing. Details of each test section are mentioned below.

PTE Exam Pattern: Speaking and Writing

PTE speaking & writing section assesses the English speaking skills and the ability to produce written English students in an academic environment. 

  • Duration: 54-67 min
  • Question Types: 7 different question types: Read aloud, Repeat sentence, Describe image, Re-tell lecture, Essay, Summarise written text and Answer short question. 

PTE Test Pattern: Reading

This section of the PTE exam pattern assesses the ability of the students to read and write in English. The type of questions covered in PTE reading section include: Fill in the blanks, Multiple-choice answers, and Re-order paragraphs. 

  • Duration: 29–30 min
  • Question Types: 5 different question types

PTE Exam Format: Listening

PTE listening section assesses the candidate’s ability to understand spoken English in various contexts. The PTE Listening section includes subjects like humanitarian studies, natural sciences, social sciences, and general knowledge.

  • Duration: 30–43 min
  • Question Types: 8 different question types based on video and audio clips

exam_name: IELTS - International English Language Testing System

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
What is IELTS exam? The IELTS exam is an international standardised English proficiency test for students who are planning to pursue higher studies abroad and for professionals looking to migrate to an English speaking country. The IELTS test assesses a candidate's ability to understand and use the English language for communication. The IELTS full form is the International English Language Testing System. IDP is the administrative body that conducts IELTS in India. IDP IELTS is designed to assess a candidate's proficiency in the English language and is taken by more than 4 million test-takers every year. It is accepted by more than 12,000 institutions, organisations, and immigration authorities globally. The IELTS 2024 has two modules - IELTS Academic and IELTS General Training.

The IELTS exam evaluates a candidate's ability to communicate in English and assesses their skills like Listening, Speaking, Reading, and Writing. Test takers are assigned IELTS band scores for each of these skills, and the scores are used to determine eligibility for educational programmes, job positions, or immigration visas in English-speaking countries. 

In countries like the USA, UK, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand, the IELTS exam is required to secure admission to their universities. The IELTS exam has long been regarded as the gold standard for assessing the English language proficiency of international students. For decades, this examination has enabled millions of individuals to achieve their dreams of studying or working abroad by demonstrating their command of the English language.

The IDP IELTS exam is conducted in two modes: a computer-based and a paper-based test. Those who wish to take the computer-based IELTS exam will attempt the listening, reading, and writing sections on a computer and take the speaking test face-to-face with an examiner. The IELTS registration can be done online from its official website, ielts.idp.com throughout the year. One can complete the online IELTS online test registration by paying the exam fee and selecting the nearest test centre and the suitable exam date. The IELTS exam fee for both Computer-based and Paper-based tests is Rs. 17,000. 

Types of IELTS Exam

IELTS exam offers two different types of exams: IELTS Academic and IELTS General Training. Although the IELTS Listening and Speaking sections remain consistent across both tests, test seekers should note that the IELTS Writing and IELTS Reading sections differ in content based on the specific exam. 

Importantly, all three core sections (Reading, Writing, and Listening) are conducted consecutively on the same test day. However, the IELTS Speaking section offers flexibility, allowing candidates to complete it a week before or after the main test date. 

Which IELTS test to take? 

The choice of whether IELTS Academic or IELTS General Training is 'good' for you and depends on your individual goals and needs. There are two primary types of IELTS exam available, and both tests, IELTS Academic vs IELTS General serve different purposes:

IELTS Academic:  IELTS Academic test is taken by Non-native English speakers who wish to pursue their higher education in an English-speaking university. However, IELTS Academic is also used for professional registration purpose as well.

IELTS General Training:

  • The IELTS GT measures your English language proficiency in practical, everyday situations.

  • It covers both workplace and social contexts, assessing your ability to communicate effectively in real-life situations.

  • This test is suitable if your goal is to work or live in an English-speaking country and you want to demonstrate your English language skills for immigration purposes.

What’s new with IELTS on Computer?

  • Candidates can now make notes and highlight text

  • Test takers can save time by copying and pasting directly from their text and notes

  • Candidates can easily browse forward and backward through the questions during the exam

  • Use the automatic word counter for the Writing test to keep track of the word count

IELTS Exam Latest Updates

  • SDS Canada Cut off-score: The IELTS academic test takers with a 6.0 overall band score can now apply for an SDS (Student Direct Stream) Canada permit starting from August 10, 2023. Previously the cut-off would be 6.0 scores for every individual skill in the exam, but now it has been made simple to just 6.0 overall band score of the exam.

  • IELTS One Skill Retake update: A new facility for IELTS exam One Skill Retake has been recently launched in India, Australia, Cambodia, Philippines, etc. Through IELTS one-skill retake, students can re-attempt any one section of the test (Listening, Reading, Writing, or Speaking) and improve their scores.

How many times is the IELTS Exam conducted in a year? 

IELTS exam is conducted throughout the year. IDP IELTS exam dates 2024 is available 7 days a week and up to 3 slots in a day. The advantage of opting for the IDP IELTS exam in a computer-based format is that candidates have more IELTS exam dates to choose from and access to IELTS results in 3 to 5 days. Whereas the IELTS paper-based test (PBT) is available 48 times a year, 4 times each month, typically scheduled on Thursdays and Saturdays.  

IELTS Exam Dates 2024

IELTS exam dates for October, November  and December 2024 are available now. IELTS computer-based test dates are available on all days of the month, and candidates can book the exam from three slots available every day.  However for IELTS paper-based test, there are 48 days fixed in a year. Why IELTS Exam is Required?

The IELTS exam score is used by individuals who want to study or work abroad but their first language is not English. IELTS 2024 is a popular exam among students looking for admission to countries like the USA, UK, Australia, Canada, New Zealand, and others. 

There are more than four million students and job aspirants who appear in the IELTS exam every year. The test is divided into four sections – Listening, Reading, Writing, and Speaking.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
Candidates preparing to appear in the IELTS exam must check the complete IELTS eligibility criteria. The IELTS exam conducting body has set no particular IELTS eligibility criteria to appear in the examination. However, students and job seekers can check eligibility for their organisation or university, wherever they are applying. Below are the eligibility criteria to apply for IELTS exam.

The eligibility criteria for IELTS exam to appear for the test are mentioned below. 

Age Requirement: There is no set age limit for IELTS candidates. Individuals of any age can take the test. However, the minimum age to appear for IDP IELTS exam is 16 years old, as the test is not recommended for candidates below this age.

Educational Qualifications: IELTS exam does not have specific educational requirements. Whether you aim to pursue higher education abroad, work internationally, or for any other purpose, you are eligible to take either the Academic or General Training of the IELTS exam.

Nationality and Background: IELTS exam is open to people of all nationalities, races, genders, and religious backgrounds. It is a universally accessible test that does not discriminate based on these factors.

Institution or Employer Requirements: While IELTS exam itself has inclusive eligibility, it's crucial to check the specific requirements of the educational institution or employer you are applying. Some institutions or employers may have additional criteria or score prerequisites for IELTS, so always verify their individual requirements.

application_process.html_content:
To appear for the IELTS exam 2024, candidates must complete the IELTS registration and schedule a test. However, it is advised that students select a nearby IELTS India test centre during registration. 

How to register for the IDP IELTS exam?

Below are the step-by-step guidelines for filling out the IELTS exam application form.

Step 1: Create an IELTS Account

To begin, you will need to create an account on the official IELTS registration website. You are required to submit your personal information, including your full name, contact details, and date of birth.

Step 2: Choose a Test Type

During registration, you will select the type of IELTS exam you wish to take. The two main options are the Academic or General Training test. Be sure to pick the one that suits your requirements.

Step 3: Select an IELTS Test Centre

You need to choose a convenient IELTS center. IDP has numerous IELTS test centers in various cities, so select one that is easily accessible for you.

Step 4: Schedule IELTS Exam Dates

After selecting a test center, you can check available IELTS exam dates 2024 and choose the one that fits your schedule. Make sure to book well in advance, as popular test dates fill up quickly.

Step 5: Submit Details

During the IELTS registration process, one needs to upload a clear, valid copy of your identification document, which typically includes your passport or national ID. Ensure that the document is current and will remain so on the test day.

Step 6: Payment of IELTS Exam Fees

Payment for the IELTS exam can be made online through the registration portal. Make sure to keep your payment receipt for future reference.

Step 7: Confirmation and Information

After successful registration and payment, you will receive a confirmation email with test details, including the date, time, and location. Be sure to review this information carefully.

IELTS Exam Fee 2024

Fees for the IELTS exam vary for different exam types. Candidates have to select their exam type and pay the IELTS registration fees while booking the IELTS slot.

IDP IELTS Exam Booking

IELTS exam offers multiple test dates throughout the year, providing flexibility for test takers. In total, there are 48 fixed IELTS exam dates in a calendar year, with tests available up to four times each month. However, it's important to note that the availability of IELTS exam dates in India can vary between the Academic and General Training modules.

For the Academic module, all 48 IELTS exam dates are accessible. This means that individuals seeking to take the IELTS Academic test have several options throughout the year.

On the other hand, for the general IELTS exam dates, there are 24 available test dates. This means that while there is still a significant number of opportunities, it's important for those specifically requiring the General Training version to be mindful of the specific IELTS exam dates 2024 on which it is offered.

The IDP IELTS slot booking can be done through the official website of the IDP IELTS exam. For Indian students, IELTS registration can be done at the IDP IELTS India website. The IELTS exam registration for the computer-based test is available three times a day and seven days a week. 

Students can appear in the IELTS exam at any of the nearest IELTS test centres by filling out the IELTS exam application form. Students can check the available IDP IELTS exam date on the IELTS exam official website.

There are several ways to book IELTS exam slot:

  • Register online and pay the IELTS exam fee.

  • Register in person at any IELTS branch or input node.

  • Complete IELTS registration by courier and pay the IELTS exam fee by demand draft or ICICI/HDFC deposit slip.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Preparing for the IELTS exam is a crucial step to achieving your desired score. The IELTS test comprises four main components: Reading, Listening, Writing, and Speaking. To score well in the IELTS exam 2024, here are some essential preparation tips for each section.

IELTS Exam Reading Preparation Tips

Below are some of the top IELTS reading tips for test takers. 

  • Practice Regularly: Consistent practice is key to improving your reading skills. Work on a variety of texts, including newspapers, academic articles, and books.
  • Skim and Scan: Develop the ability to quickly skim through a passage to get the main idea and scan for specific details. This will save time during the actual IELTS exam.
  • Expand Vocabulary: Improve your vocabulary by learning and understanding the meaning of unfamiliar words. Keep a vocabulary journal and use flashcards to reinforce your memory.
  • Understand Question Types: Familiarise yourself with different IELTS exam question types, such as multiple-choice, true/false/not given, and matching headings. Practice these question types to become proficient.
  • Time Management: During IELTS practice tests, practice managing your time effectively. Allocate a specific amount of time to each passage and stick to it.

IELTS Exam Listening Preparation Tips

Students must check the below-mentioned IELTS listening tips to prepare for this section effectively. 

Immerse Yourself: Listen to a variety of English content, including podcasts, news broadcasts, and movies. This will make you familiar with different accents and speeds of speech.

Take Notes: During the listening test, take notes to help you remember key details. Be concise in your note-taking to avoid missing information.

Practice Dictation: Transcribing spoken words or sentences from audio can improve your listening and writing skills simultaneously.

Mock Tests: Practice IELTS listening test under real conditions to simulate the real test environment. This will help you manage stress and time effectively.

Repeat Practice: Repeatedly listen to the same audio passages to improve your comprehension and pick up on details you might have missed initially.

IELTS Exam Writing Preparation Tips

Structure Matters: Understand the structure for both the IELTS Academic and General Training writing tasks. Practice writing essays, reports, and letters with a clear introduction, body, and conclusion.

Expand Vocabulary: A strong vocabulary is essential for writing. Learn synonyms and varied sentence structures to make your writing more engaging.

Proofreading: Always review and edit your writing for grammatical errors and clarity. Simple mistakes can affect your score.

Time Management: Time is limited for writing tasks in the IELTS exam, so practice completing essays or reports within the given time frame. This helps improve your writing speed.

Feedback and Review: Get proper feedback on your writing from teachers, peers, or online communities. Regularly review and analyse your work to identify areas for improvement.

Also Read : Tips for IELTS Writing Task 2

IELTS Exam Speaking Preparation Tips

Practice Speaking Aloud: Practice speaking in English as much as possible. Talk to yourself or find a speaking partner to communicate regularly.

Recording: Record your spoken responses during practice sessions. Listening to your own recordings can help you identify pronunciation and fluency issues.

Structured Responses: When answering speaking questions, use a structured approach: introduce the topic, present key points, and summarise with a conclusion.

Expand Topics: Practice speaking on a wide range of topics to build confidence in discussing various subjects.

Mock Interviews: Conduct mock interviews with a teacher or a language partner to simulate the speaking test environment and get feedback.

IELTS Preparation Books

Students preparing for the IELTS exam must refer to some of the best IELTS book and study material. Below is a list of IELTS preparation books by the British Council and Cambridge. 

  • The Official Cambridge Guide to IELTS

  • Cambridge IELTS 9

  • How to Prepare for IELTS

  • Official IELTS Practice Materials Volume 1 and 2

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The IELTS exam pattern comprises 4 sections or parameters in which a candidate's proficiency in English is evaluated:

  • Reading

  • Writing

  • Listening

  • Speaking

The IELTS exam has two formats: IELTS Academic and IELTS General Training. The Reading and Writing sections differ between the two formats, while the Listening and Speaking sections are the same.

The reading, writing, and listening sections are conducted on the same day and the IELTS speaking test is conducted in a separate slot which is in a 7-day window after or before the reading-writing-listening slot.

IELTS 2024 Exam Pattern 

IELTS Sections

No. of Questions/Duration

Content

Reading

40 Questions (60 minutes)

  • Multiple choice questions
  • Sentence completion
  • Summary completion
  • Matching features
  • Matching headings

Writing

2 Questions (60 minutes)

Two writing tasks

Listening

40 Questions (30 minutes plus 10 minutes transfer time for the paper-based test)

  • Multiple choice questions
  • Diagram labelling
  • Sentence completion
  • Summary completion

Speaking

3-part conversation (11-14 minutes)

Three parts conversation

The speaking module comprises 3 parts one-on-one conversations with an IELTS exam representative and this IELTS component is scored based on the candidate's oral performance in a life-like environment. Candidates are given the option to take the speaking test on any other day.

IELTS Test Format: Sections and Question Types

As aforementioned, the IELTS exam consists of four sections that test your proficiency in English: Listening, Reading, Writing, and Speaking. The total IELTS duration is 2 hours and 45 minutes. Check details of each IELTS exam section:

IELTS Listening Section

  • Duration: 30 minutes
  • IELTS Listening Section Question Types: Multiple choice, matching, plan/map/diagram labelling, form completion, note completion, table completion, flow-chart completion, summary completion, sentence completion

IELTS Reading Section

  • Duration: 60 minutes
  • Question Types of IELTS Reading Section: Multiple choice, identifying information, identifying the writer's views/claims, matching information, matching headings, matching features, matching sentence endings, sentence completion, summary completion, note completion, table completion, flow-chart completion, diagram label completion, short-answer questions

IELTS Writing Section

  • Duration: 60 minutes
  • Task 1: You will be presented with a graph, table, chart, or diagram and asked to describe, summarize, or explain the information in your own words.
  • Task 2: You will be asked to write an essay in response to a point of view, argument, or problem.

IELTS Speaking Section

  • Duration: 11-14 minutes
  • IELTS Format: Introduction and interview, Cue Card/Candidate Task Card, and Discussion

IELTS Scoring: IELTS scores range from 0 to 9, with each section (Listening, Reading, Writing, and Speaking) assigned a band score. Your overall IELTS score is the average of these four scores, rounded to the nearest half or whole band.

faqs.question: What is the IELTS pass score?
faqs.answer: There are no passing or failing marks in the IELTS test; the desired university's requirements can help you in setting your IELTS score goal. However, many universities accept a score of 6.0 or above. You can check the official website of your desired university and find out the minimum IELTS score requirement.

faqs.question: Is 6.5 IELTS score easy?
faqs.answer: IELTS score of 6.5 is an achievable score with proper focus, dedication and preparation. The IELTS score that you achieve also depends on your proficiency in the English language. It is advisable that applicants practice for each section of the test through mock tests and preparation materials.

faqs.question: Is 7.5 IELTS score easy?
faqs.answer: A 7.5 IELTS score is generally considered a good score. Top universities like Harvard University, Stanford University, British Columbia University and many others accept a 7.5 IELTS score. Success in IELTS depends on various factors, including your current English skills, the amount of preparation you undertake, and your familiarity with the test format. Some test-takers find it relatively easier, while others may need significant preparation and practice to reach this level however, it is not impossible.

faqs.question: What are the 4 types of IELTS?
faqs.answer: Applicants can choose the type of IELTS based on their requirement while registering for the exam. There are 4 types of IELTS, namely: IELTS Academic, IELTS General Training, IELTS UKVI and IELTS Life Skills.

faqs.question: Can I learn IELTS in 3 months?
faqs.answer: Yes, IELTS preparation can be done through 3 months; however, this might be a challenging task. To achieve this goal, applicants must prepare well using preparation materials, mock tests and eBooks. You can also prepare a study plan and prepare for the IELTS exam with dedication and focus.

faqs.question: How much does IDP IELTS cost?
faqs.answer: IDP IELTS costs around Rs. 17,000 for both computer-based and paper-based formats. in addition, the cost remains the same for IELTS academic and IELTS General Training as well. However, there are additional charges in exceptional cases like cancellation fee, rescheduling fee, rechecking fee and fee for Additional Test Reports Form.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for IELTS exam?
faqs.answer: IDP has not formulated any specific guidelines for IELTS eligibility. However, applicants of age 16 years or older can apply for this exam irrespective of their religion, gender and background. There are no minimum educational requirements as well. Nonetheless, the applicant must have a valid passport.

faqs.question: Is IELTS very difficult?
faqs.answer: IELTS's difficulty is subjective. If the IELTS exam is easy or difficult, it largely depends on your English proficiency and level of preparation. With adequate study and practice, many individuals can achieve their desired scores, making IELTS more manageable. The applicant is advised to go through various preparation materials, sample papers and mock tests to make their IELTS journey smooth.

faqs.question: What is the IELTS exam for?
faqs.answer: The IELTS: International English Language Testing System is designed to assess an individual's English language proficiency, particularly for those who are non-native English speakers. IELTS measures a test taker's abilities in reading, writing, listening, and speaking. It is used for various purposes, such as university admissions, visa applications, and employment requirements.

exam_name: Oxford ELLT - Oxford English Language Level Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Oxford ELLT Digital is an online English language proficiency test conducted by the Oxford ELLT, part of Oxford International Digital Institute. Oxford ELLT Digital is an internationally recognized English language proficiency test accepted by more than 55 universities worldwide. Applicants looking for language proficiency certification can apply for the Oxford ELLT Digital to secure admission into the top universities accepting Oxford ELLT Digital score. It is a fully online test, and the assessment is broken down into four stages in order to assess candidates English language abilities in all the four skills- reading, listening, writing, and speaking.

Candidates can register for the Oxford ELLT Digital at their convenience to appear for an online mode exam by paying a fee of £120. The test is designed such that students can take it at their pace. Application for the test is ongoing and could be taken by simply registering yourself on the Oxford ELLT portal. Some of the Oxford ELLT accepted universities in UK are mentioned below:

eligibility_criteria.html_content: Oxford ELLT Digital doesn’t have any eligibility criteria. It is available for students looking to study a university course that requires an English language proficiency qualification, who recognize the ELLT Digital test.

application_process.html_content:
Candidates can appear for the test by registering themselves on the official Oxford ELLT Portal.

How to fill Oxford ELLT application form?

  • Visit the Oxford ELLT Portal.
  • Complete the Registration Form
  • Upload a scan of the ID page of your passport. Take a photo of yourself (it will appear on the certificate).
  • Activate your account through the link received in your email. 
  • Click ‘Get Started’ to make payment for the Oxford ELLT fees.
  • Once payment has been made candidates will be able to access test content immediately.
  • Candidates must complete the reading and listening tests before being able to access the writing test, and then book a speaking test.
  • To appear for the speaking test, select time zone, day, and time. Speaking tests are available to book 24 hours ahead of time. 

Note: ELLT Test fees is EUR 120.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Students can use the following tips for the Oxford ELLT test preparation.

  • Go through the syllabus. 
  • Identify sections which you find difficult. 
  • Take more practice exams. Refer to Oxford ELLT test sample question papers. 
  • Try working English practice into your day-to-day routine. 
  • Comprehension of language could be increased by listening to english-language podcasts. 
  • Keep notes handy for quick revision.
  • Search for ELLT speaking presentation topics and practice them.

Oxford ELLT has 2 ELLT test preparation material and courses available to book (courses can be booked directly at oxfordellt.com).

ELLT Preparation Course: 3x 90min sessions with a live Oxford ELLT Tutor – via video call includes full test walk through, sample materials and full mock test.

ELLT Prep+: Asynchronous Oxford ELLT test preparation course – 8 modules which include test overview, practice materials, additional self-study, and Examiner hints & Tips.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
Oxford ELLT Digital is a modularised English Language proficiency test, which consists of listening, reading, writing, and speaking. The ELLT Test structure is designed such that students can appear for the test with ease and at their own pace. Below table shows the time duration allotted to every module and the number of questions candidates will be required to answer.

Oxford ELLT Digital Test Structure

Reading Test

The reading test lasts 40-minutes. You will be required to answer 32 questions based on two different reading texts (16 questions per text).

Listening Test

During the listening test you will hear 3 different audio tracks, a Monologue (played once), a Dialogue (played twice)and a Listening Analysis (played twice). In total there are 28 questions, you have 25-minute to complete the listening test.

Writing Test

  • The writing test lasts 60-minutes. You will complete one essay question and you must write between 250 and 350 words.
  • Your writing test is marked by the same examiner that will conduct your speaking test.

Speaking Test

  • The speaking test is broken down into four sections and lasts approximately 30-minutes.
  • Section one (unassessed) is an introduction, your examiner will ask you a couple of introductory questions and ask you to confirm your identity.
  • Section two is the presentation task; you will be required to present on the given topic for between 3 and 5 minutes.
  • Section three is based on the writing test, your examiner will ask you a number of questions all relating to your answer from the written test, these questions could be about your choice of vocabulary (lexical questions) or the ideas you wrote about.
  • The final section (Section four) is an examiner led discussion based on a visual prompt. Your examiner will show you an image for 15 seconds and will lead a discussion based on the image shown. You should attempt to speak freely with your examiner about the given image.

Oxford ELLT exam pattern

ModulesTask TypeTotal Time DurationNumber of questions
ListeningMonologue, Dialogue, Listening Analysis40 min28 questions
Reading2 reading passages25 min32 questions
Writing1 opinion style essay question60 min1 question
SpeakingLive speaking exam with Oxford ELLT Examiner via video call30 min4 parts

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
Duolingo English Test: Duolingo conducts the DET Test. It is an English proficiency test which students attempt to study, work, and migrate to English-speaking countries like the USA, UK and Canada. Duolingo English Test examines proficiency in all four language competencies: reading, writing, listening, and speaking, providing a thorough assessment of the test taker’s English skills. The DET Exam is not only accessible online, but it is computer adaptive, which means that the difficulty of the Duolingo test questions changes in response to each test taker's performance. No question is likely to repeat itself, making it a unique experience for the test takers availing the test. 

The DET test score is determined by the grading engine, which is trained to comprehend language skills the same way as human experts do. Duolingo test takers can receive an accurate DET score even if the Duolingo English duration is only one hour. Duolingo result are available in 2 days which includes total score, subscores, writing sample, and speaking sample. Duolingo scores can be shared to a number of institutions without any additional cost. 

Duolingo Exam Dates 2024

Duolingo, the conducting body of DET, has not specified any particular date for the exam. All candidates can take the exam anytime from the convenience of their home or anywhere in the world. The Duolingo English Test 2024 is conducted on all days of the week, the test takers can book the test based on their own choices. For more information, students can check out the official website of Duolingo.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
According to Duolingo, there is no academic criteria for attempting the Duolingo English Test. Candidates need not prove their academic qualifications to take the Duolingo exam. Anyone from anywhere can register, make payments, and can appear for the test. However, a few of the requirements are mentioned below.

Duolingo 2024 Eligibility Criteria

Criteria

Details

Duolingo Age Requirement

There is no age limit for the test takers, however, if the individuals are below the age of 13, they must submit a parental consent.

Identification

All test takers must have a valid, government-issued photo ID such as a passport, driver’s license, or a national ID.

application_process.html_content:
Candidates can appear for the Duolingo English test online. After the submission of Duolingo application form on the official website, test takers can take the test any time in the next 21 days. Below are the detailed steps on the Duolingo English registration process. 

Step 1: Visit the official website of Duolingo - englishtest.duolingo.com. 

Step 2: Sign up using your email ID. 

Step 3: Click on Purchase a Test and select either 1 test or 2 tests and add to cart. 

Step 4: Purchase the Duolingo exam and pay the Duolingo exam fees. 

Step 5: Now candidates can book the slot for the Duolingo exam within 21 days and appear in the Duolingo English Test.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Appearing for the Duolingo English test can be stressful, but if one is prepared, it can be made a little easier. The Duolingo test is specifically designed to accurately evaluate a test taker's overall skill in English. Furthermore, the DET official website provides a free Duolingo practice test that allows the applicant to become familiar with the question types that appear in the actual exam. 

This Duolingo English test practice can be repeated numerous times, giving the test taker a realistic test experience that corresponds to the live test.  Candidates can practice the Duolingo mock test at any time online using a laptop at home, however, the Duolingo practice test timeline may differ from the original exam timeline. To prepare well for the Duolingo English test, follow the steps mentioned below: 

  • Familiarise yourself with the test structure, which comprises reading, writing, speaking, and listening sections.

  • Use recognised practice tests, such as Duolingo, to enhance your general language abilities.

  • Listen to English podcasts, articles, and videos to increase your vocabulary.

  • Interact with fluent speakers or use language exchange platforms.

  • Write essays, emails, or diary entries to improve your writing skills.

  • To enhance your speed and accuracy, practice answering questions under a time constraint.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The Duolingo English Test evaluates the English-speaking ability of the test takers. Duolingo exam pattern is divided into 2 sections: Adaptive test and Writing & Speaking Sample. Along with this, students are provided with an introduction and onboarding on how to attempt the test. A detailed overview of Duolingo English test structure is mentioned below:

Duolingo English Test Exam pattern 

Section

Skills tested

Duration

Introduction and onboarding

Ensure your computer’s camera, speakers, and microphone are functioning properly. Submit your government-issued photo ID. Review the test rules and requirements to avoid breaking any rules. 

5 mins

Adaptive test

Measures your English skills through a series of different question types such as Read and Complete, Read and Select, Listen and Select etc. 

45 minutes

Writing and Speaking Sample 

You will be given a prompt and asked to respond at length 

10 minutes

Duolingo English Test duration: The Duolingo test lasts for one hour in total.  It is split into two sections - the adaptive section which takes 45 minutes and the Speaking and Writing Section which takes just 10 minutes.

exam_name: GMAT Focus Edition - Graduate Management Admission Test - Focus Edition

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
What is GMAT exam? GMAT is a computer-based adaptive test conducted by GMAC. GMAT is taken by students seeking admission to master’s programmes in the field of management, business or MBA. The GMAT full form is Graduate Management Admission Test. Through GMAT exam, the test takers can enroll in business or management-related courses in top B-schools across the world. GMAT 2024 evaluates the analytical, writing, quantitative, verbal, and reading skills of an individual. GMAT exam has been replaced by the GMAT Focus Edition from February 1, 2024. As per the latest update, the GMAT Focus Edition 2024 is shorter than the old GMAT, with a total test time of 2 hours and 15 minutes compared to 3 hours and 7 minutes in the old version.

Graduate Management Admission Council (GMAC) introduced the GMAT exam - focus edition is an entrance exam for getting admission into business schools to more than 7000 programs provided by 2400 universities worldwide. Registration for the GMAT Exam - Focus Edition has been started on August 29, 2023, while the testing is scheduled to begin on November 7, 2023. The GMAT Exam Dates 2024 are available all round the year.

With the updating trends, the GMAT is also upgraded to the GMAT exam - focus edition. This GMAT focus edition meets the demands of B-Schools and focuses on testing higher-order critical reasoning and data literacy skills. It accelerates your future career in B-schools. The new pattern of the GMAT exam is efficient, flexible, and insightfully redesigned considering the requirements of leading business schools and its wide number of courses, and programs available worldwide.

The GMAT focus edition is similar to the current GMAT exam, it is a computer-based test that can be attempted from home or at a test centre. A bit of change in the GMAT exam pattern and syllabus which comes in only 3 sections with lowered test duration and insightful GMAT focus edition scoring are discussed in detail in this article.

Changes in the Test Pattern: GMAT Focus Edition

  • GMAT exam - focus edition duration will be 2 hours and 15 minutes (exclusive of one optional break of 10 minutes). 
  • There will be three 45-minute sections and no essay. Candidates can attempt sections in any order. 
  • Candidates can now bookmark and review as many GMAT questions as they want. 
  • A new section called Data Insights (DI) will be introduced in the GMAT focus edition syllabus, while sentence correction will be removed. 
  • The GMAT exam - focus edition score scale will be 205-805. All three sections will be weighed equally towards the total score.
  • The 2 reasoning sections of “Quantitative Reasoning & Verbal” will be the same in the GMAT exam syllabus. The syllabus of the newly added data insights section is the only difference.

    Data Insights - This section measures the ability to analyse and interpret data and how you can apply it to real-world business scenarios. The questions require the concepts of maths, analysis, and verbal reasoning for solving. A total of  20 questions in the types of data sufficiency, multi-source reasoning, table analysis, graphics interpretation, and two-part analysis are followed in the exam.

GMAT Exam Date 2024

GMAT is conducted across different states in India. Students must book the GMAT test centre and date at least 2-3 months prior to the exam. You can check the nearest test centre that you can reach easily on the exam day. Almost all the dates in the coming months of 2024 are available for the GMAT.
