GMAT Vs CAT Exam

GMAT or Graduate Management Admission Test and CAT or Common Admission Test are widely popular among the business schools for giving admission to their programmes including the top business schools and IIMs as well. There is one major difference between GMAT and CAT Exam is that GMAT entrance test is accepted by business schools across the world while CAT is majorly popular amongst business schools in India. GMAT scores are also accepted by many top business schools in India as well. GMAT is usually given by students who wish to pursue business or management course abroad. The IIMs accept the GMAT score of Indian domestic candidates for their executive management programmes. Also, there is a huge difference between the costs of both the entrance tests. The GMAT costs $250, whereas, the CAT Exam costs Rs. 1100. So, CAT Exam is relatively cheaper than GMAT.

highlights.value: Graduate Management Admission Test - Focus Edition

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
The GMAC (Graduate Management Admission Council) that conducts the GMAT exam - focus edition does not have eligibility criteria for the GMAT exam. However, candidates planning to take the GMAT focus edition exam must have a government ID at the time of the exam. GMAT exam eligibility criteria 2024 is mentioned below. 

  • Age: Candidates must be at least 18 years of age, those between the age of 13 to 17 years must provide a parental consent.

  • Identity proof: Test takers must provide a valid passport, driving license or other identification documents issued by the government of India.

  • Academic Qualification: Students must have an undergraduate degree to study masters abroad.

application_process.html_content:
The application process for the GMAT focus edition is similar to the current GMAT exam registration. For GMAT exam focus edition registration, candidates have to register for the mba.com account where a few personal and academic details need to be submitted and candidates need to upload the required documents. Once the account is created the candidate can book the slot through which the GMAT exam date, GMAT test centre, and timings for the GMAT focus can be selected based on convenience.

The steps to be followed for the GMAT focus edition registration process are mentioned below.

  • Step 1:  Log in to your mba.com account with your user ID and password

  • Step 2: Go to GMAT Registration tab

  • Step 3: Enter your personal information and verify your profile

GMAT Slot Booking

After registering for the GMAT exam, one needs to book the slot for the GMAT exam and pay the fee. The step-wise GMAT slot booking process has been mentioned below, one can check the same for their reference. 

  • Step 1: One needs to log in to the official website, with their GMAT login credentials
  • Step 2: Then, select the preferred GMAT exam date and nearest test centre and confirm exam details
  • Step 3: After entering the valid details, one needs to pay the GMAT registration fee and complete your GMAT Slot booking.

GMAT Exam Fees 2024

The GMAT exam fee in India is USD 300 approximately Rs. 25,060 for the online format and USD 275 approximately Rs. 22,975 for the test centre format. Additionally, applicants must pay a rescheduling or cancellation fee if they intend to change or cancel their 2024 GMAT exam date. Students who fail to attend their scheduled exam will be charged the full GMAT exam fee.

preparation_tips.html_content:
Acquiring some GMAT prep tips gives you a smoother push to the preparation. This GMAT exam - focus edition provides students with an onscreen calculator for the data insights section that helps you during the preparation.

Here are a few basic tips that help you with GMAT focus edition exam -

  • Start your preparation with a GMAT diagnostic test: Taking the diagnostic tests help in evaluating your current knowledge and skills in each particular section and helps you to know any weakness in particular subjects. Based on this you can create a study plan.

  • Create or use a study plan: If you are a beginner to GMAT and giving your first attempt, the official GMAC provides the GMAT exam - focus edition study plan, which will be useful for the test takers.

  • Use the existing GMAT study material: As the syllabus has changed only for the data insights section, the candidates can use the available GMAT preparation material for the Qualitative and verbal reasoning sections.

  • Create an everyday schedule: Contribute specific hours in a day for your GMAT preparation. Discipline is the one that helps in maintaining the consistency of your efforts throughout the preparation period for your exam.

exam_name: CAPLE - Centre for Evaluation of Portuguese as a Foreign Language
conducting_body: University of Lisbon and the Instituto Camões on behalf of the Portuguese Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
CAPLE (Centro de Avaliação de Português Língua Estrangeira or Centre for Evaluation of Portuguese as a Foreign Language) or the CAPLE exam refers to a certificate of proficiency in Standard European Portuguese as a second language offered in Portugal and 45 other countries and territories. The School of Arts and Humanities at the University of Lisbon and the Instituto Camões collaborated in a tripartite agreement in Portugal and together developed, delivered, and accredited this language proficiency exam. 

The CAPLE exam is administered by these institutes on behalf of the Portuguese Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The CAPLE exam assesses the Portuguese language skills of candidates with these proficiency tests at six levels from A1 To C2 from the age group 16 years and over. The school versions of these CAPLE exams are also available for younger individuals. CAPLE exams are held three times (3) a year while the school version of CAPLE tests are held only once. More details regarding CAPLE eligibility, the application process, the CAPLE syllabus, and the CAPLE exam pattern are discussed in this exam page below.

highlights.value: Centre for Evaluation of Portuguese as a Foreign Language
University of Lisbon and the Instituto Camões on behalf of the Portuguese Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
In order to be able to take the regular CAPLE exam, the candidate's age must be at least 16 years or more and be a national of a country where Portuguese is not an official language. The following are the minimum required eligibility criteria to attempt the CAPLE exams.

  1. Age

  • 16 years or more for Regular CAPLE Tests

  • 12-15 years for school versions of CAPLE tests

  • 9-11 years for progressive CAPLE tests.

  1. Passport

  2. National Identification Document or Residence Permit

 In case the candidate is from a country where Portuguese is an official language, they have to fulfil two of the following conditions:

  1. The first language of their parents should not be Portuguese.

  2. The acquired first language should not be Portuguese.

  3. The candidate’s main language of communication should not be Portuguese.

  4. All or part of their secondary education should not be in Portuguese.

application_process.html_content:
The mode of application for the CAPLE 2024 exam is online. The candidate can register for the test at the official CAPLE website and can book a slot for the exam based on the CAPLE exam dates. The mode of payment can be done only through a credit card. After registration, the candidate has 24 hours to make the payment. 

The detailed steps for CAPLE 2024 exam

Step 1 -

Visit the Offical CAPLE website caple.letras.ulisboa.pt

Step 2 -

Check for the exam section and select the register option

Step 3 -

Choose the exam and location where you are attempting the  CAPLE test

Step 4 -

Select the available test center and date

Step 5 -

Fill in the personal details

Step 6 -

Finally, complete the application process by making the payment with a credit card

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
There are four categories of evaluation in the CAPLE exam in all major language proficiency levels - Reading, Writing, Listening, and Speaking. There is also an additional category of evaluation of your Portuguese language proficiency known as "Competência Estrutural", which is a part of only the DIPLE, DAPLE, and DUPLE tests. The weightage and the duration of time assigned for each section varies according to the level of the CAPLE test. 

CAPLE Exam Pattern Outline

Language Proficiency Levels

Language Proficiency Tasks

Compreensão da Leitura (Reading Comprehension)

This section entails the candidates to read and understand the written information given and record their responses in accordance with what they have read. 

Produção e Interação Escritas (Written Production and Interaction)

This section entails the candidates to fill out forms and enter personal information. They also have to write understandable and clear informational texts like private letters or notes.

Competência Estrutural (Structural Competence

This section entails the candidates to fill in blanks with appropriate words or restructure texts in various formats. They also have to change sentences that need transformation. 

Compreensão Oral (Oral Comprehension)

This section entails the candidates to carefully listen to and understand simple conversations and answer related queries. 

Produção e Interação Orais (Oral Production and Interaction)

This section entails the candidates to take part in simple conversations. Candidates have the option of interacting with the examiner, other candidates, and/or both.

faqs.question: What is the Portuguese language certificate for citizenship?
faqs.answer: For citizenship in Portugal, the candidate has to acquire the certificate of CIPLE exam which is level A2.

faqs.question: What are the types of CAPLE Portuguese language exams?
faqs.answer: There are two exams for checking Portuguese language proficiency. One is the CAPLE exam for checking European Portuguese in Portugal country and CELPE-Bras is the exam recognized and accepted by the Brazilian government

faqs.question: Is the CAPLE Portuguese language test online?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Portuguese language test conducted by CAPLE is online at the CAPLE exam centres

faqs.question: Where are the CAPLE exam centres located in India?
faqs.answer: The CAPLE exam centres are located in New Delhi and Goa in India.

faqs.question: What does CAPLE consist of?
faqs.answer: The CAPLE exam consists of four sections-listening, reading, writing and speaking. There is also an additional category of evaluation of your Portuguese language proficiency known as "Competência Estrutural", which is a part of only the DIPLE, DAPLE, and DUPLE tests.

faqs.question: Is CAPLE worth it?
faqs.answer: It is worth taking the CAPLE exam because it is accepted in countries where Portugese is spoken. The test is considered as a qualifying criteria for employment, immigration, and enrolment in universities in these countries. The course consists of practice of all four modules (CAPLE) Listening, Reading, Writing, & Speaking.

faqs.question: Do language certificates expire?
faqs.answer: The language certificates do not officially expire. Though there might be situations where a university may ask to produce latest results and not accept results older than two to three years from the date of the test.

faqs.question: How hard is the CAPLE Portuguese language test?
faqs.answer: The CAPLE Portuguese language test is a relatively simple exam. It simply tests your ability to use and understand everyday language and expressions that you would use on a day-to-day basis.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of having CAPLE Portugese language certification?
faqs.answer: A language certification tests your language proficiency in listening, reading, grammar and vocabulary skills and provides you with a platform to officially demonstrate your language skills in an academic and professional environment. It is a great way to make your profile stand out amongst the crowd.

faqs.question: What is the certificate of Portuguese as a Foreign Language?
faqs.answer: The CAPLE (Centro de Avaliação do Português Língua Estrangeira) exam is an official certification system that assesses competence in Portuguese as a Foreign Language (PLE). The CAPLE certification is the only Portuguese language certification recognized in the European framework.

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
What is SAT exam? A standardised test widely used for admission into undergraduate courses in abroad countries specifically for the United States and Canada. The SAT exam is administered by the College Board. The College Board is a non-profit organisation that conducts the SAT test to assess a student's readiness for college. 

The SAT exam full form is the Scholastic Assessment Test. The test primarily evaluates a student's mathematical, verbal, and writing skills. The SAT registration can be done online through the official College Board website. Earlier, the SAT exam was a pencil-paper-based test, however, the College Board scrapped this format last year and introduced SAT Digital which is a computer-delivered format.

The SAT exam is taken by high school students who plan to enrol in an undergraduate program abroad. Usually, high school juniors and seniors (classes 11 and 12) take the SAT test to seek admission at a foreign university. The SAT 2024 is an accepted exam for admission to many schools and universities based in the United States, Canada, Australia, and many popular study destinations of the world. Even, many Indian universities also accept the SAT for admission into their undergraduate courses. SAT test provides colleges with a common data point that can be used to compare the academic preparedness of applicants.

What is SAT Digital? 

Since March 2023, the digital SAT has been administered to all international students excluding US. From spring 2024, the digital SAT has been administered by all students - international and US students. This change aims to ensure that all students, regardless of their location, can benefit from a more modern and efficient testing experience.

This SAT is conducted seven times a year across 30 Indian cities, and hosted in more than 50 partnering institutions. What sets the SAT Digital exam apart is its streamlined nature; it takes 2 hours and 14 minutes to complete. Notably, the SAT Digital exam is one hour shorter compared to its previous version. Adding to the convenience, students are now allowed to bring their own laptops or iPads to the SAT test centres.

What is same in Digital SAT and SAT?

The written SAT exam was scored on a 400 - 1600 point scale, the Digital SAT has also been scored on the same scale. Also, the test will be administered by proctors at official test centres and students who require an accommodation will get the same support with an option of a paper test.

SAT Digital Exam Pattern

The SAT Digital exam consists of two main sections: the reading and writing section and the mathematics section. Each SAT exam section is scored on a scale of 400 to 800 marks, with a potential total score of 1600 marks. 

Importantly, SAT scores are calculated and reported based on individual section scores, providing a detailed breakdown of a student's performance in each area. This comprehensive scoring in the SAT system allows both students and colleges to gain valuable insights into a test-taker's academic strengths and weaknesses.

SAT Exam Latest Updates: What’s New?

  • SAT Digital Test dates have been announced for 2025.
  • The new SAT test (Digital SAT) will be shorter. The exam now lasts two hours rather than three.
  • The SAT 2024-25 reading passages will now be shorter. The SAT exam syllabus will cover a wide range of subjects that correspond to the subjects that college students study.
  • Calculators will be permitted for the SAT exam 2024-25 Math component.
  • The SAT results will come through quickly so that students and teachers can get their SAT scores within days.
  • Instead of five chances throughout the year, international applicants will now have seven opportunities to take the SAT exam. 
  • From 2024 only the Digital SAT version is available internationally. It will go into effect in the US starting in the spring 2024.
  • There won't be a paper-and-pencil SAT exam since all international testing sites will switch to digital SAT dates in 2024-25. This applies to the SAT exam India as well.
  • All students taking PSAT-related tests will use digital testing. However, pen and paper will be used for the SAT School Day and SAT Weekend administrations in the United States.
  • From spring 2024, the entire SAT Suite of Assessments will be available online.
  • The SAT exam will be graded out of 1600 points. Assessments will not be given at home but rather in a testing facility or school with a proctor present.

SAT Exam Dates 2024

The dates for the SAT exam 2024 and SAT 2025 are available. Candidates can check SAT test dates for 2024-25 and register for the exam. SAT test dates for 2024 are mentioned below as well.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
SAT Exam Eligibility: The College Board does not mandate SAT eligibility criteria for students, so any candidate irrespective of their age may appear for the SAT exam 2024. That being said, here are some points the candidate may refer to before booking for the SAT 2024.

What is the age limit for SAT  Exam? 

  • Generally, high school students in the age group 17-19 years take the SAT exam.

  • If the candidates fall under 13 years age group, their parent or guardian will need to submit the account creation consent form via mail to College Board to book the SAT test registration 2024.

  • Candidates above 21 years of age have to provide a government-issued photo ID at the test centre on the SAT examination day.

Who can register for SAT in India?

Indian students seeking admission to a college or university undergraduate programme abroad usually register and appear for the SAT exam.

However, in some conditions, candidates can appear in SAT 2024 applying for scholarships, financial aid, or other programs that require a college admission test as part of their application process.

The SAT exam tests the mathematical, writing, and critical reading skills of the students. The SAT questions are mostly based on their high school studies.

application_process.html_content:
SAT Exam Registration: The College Board offers registration in online mode. Students planning to take the SAT 2024 can register for SAT through mobile or computer from anywhere in their comfort. For SAT exam 2024 registration, you need to visit the College Board official website and complete the online procedure. 

SAT online registration offers a streamlined, user-friendly, and highly accessible process, making it the preferred choice of students. You can easily pay the SAT exam fee while doing the exam registration on College Board’s official website.

Moreover, online SAT registration is the way to go for individuals who need to re-register for the SAT due to a missed initial test date. It permits such candidates to change SAT exam dates and test centers. 

Also, SAT exam 2024 registration is a convenient 30-minute process. Make sure you have a photo meeting the SAT test registration requirements.

In case an applicant needs to register for the SAT 2024 on a late registration deadline, then also you can follow the same registration process online. The SAT exam 2024 dates fall in  March, May, June, August, October, November, and December. The SAT exam 2024 registration date starts  2 months before the given examination date.

Steps for SAT Online Registration 

The following steps outline the simple SAT registration process. Check the details and proceed accordingly.

  • Step 1: To register for the SAT online, candidates should start by creating a personal login ID on the official SAT website.

  • Step 2: Once the login ID is created, students can proceed with the registration process conveniently from their own devices.

  • Step 3: Aspirants have to enter all essential details in the SAT exam 2024 application form and answer the relevant questions.

  • Step 4: Select an exam centre from the available options. Also, one needs to select an SAT exam date during the registration.

  • Step 5: Upload scanned photographs in the prescribed format.

  • Step 6: Pay the SAT exam 2024 registration fee to complete the process.

This online registration method for the SAT offers flexibility and is the most commonly used option for students.

SAT Exam Fee 2024

The SAT registration fee in India is USD 68 (approx INR 5,664). In addition to this basic fee, international test takers outside of the United States are required to pay an SAT regional fee of USD 43 (approx INR 3,581). When you combine these two fees, the total SAT exam 2024 fees in India is USD 111 (approx INR 9,245). Please note that these figures are subject to change, so it's always a good practice to verify the latest fees on the official Collge Board website. According to the official information provided on the website, the SAT exam fees in India for the year 2024 are structured as follows:

  • Basic SAT Exam Fee: The registration fee for the standard SAT exam 2024 is USD 68, which is equivalent to INR 5,664.

  • Additional Regional Fee for International Test-Takers: In addition to the basic exam fee, international test-takers outside the United States are required to pay an extra USD 43, which amounts to INR 3,581. This regional fee is applicable to ensure the smooth administration of the SAT in international locations.

  • Total Cost for International Test-Takers in India: When you combine the basic SAT exam fee with the international regional fee, the total cost for an international test-taker in India is USD 111 or INR 9,245.

SAT Exam Fee Reduction for Indian Students

Through the Indian Scholars Program, the College Board offers the SAT exam fee discount vouchers for Indian students. Students from lower-income backgrounds can apply for these discount vouchers. You can apply for these SAT fee vouchers at the "Buddy for Study" website of the College Board. Everyone who meets the eligibility given below can reduce 50 to 90%  of their SAT exam fee. 

Eligibility for 50% discount fee Vouchers:

  • Resident of India.
  • Studying in 11th or 12th class.
  • Family income level between INR 8 to 15 lakhs

Eligibility for 90% discount fee Vouchers:

  • Resident of India.
  • Studying in 11th or 12th class.
  • Family income level below INR 8 lakhs.

preparation_tips.html_content:
SAT exam preparation: Preparing for the SAT 2024 can be a challenging but rewarding experience. Here are some SAT preparation tips to help you succeed on this important standardised test:

  • Understanding the SAT exam 2024: Candidates should be clear about the format and the types of questions that appear on the exam for better SAT preparation.

  • Grasp Concepts: Candidates should ensure that they have a firm knowledge and understanding of the subject areas assessed by the SAT. This can be done through regular study and revision of the topics taught in school.

  • Practice/ Mock Tests: Candidates should solve SAT practice tests and mock tests in a timed environment to gain a semblance of the testing day procedures. Taking the practice test will also allow the candidate to pinpoint areas that need further study or SAT preparation.

  • Follow a Schedule: Candidates must maintain a schedule for SAT 2024 preparation to ensure regular study and practice in order to obtain a high SAT score.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
SAT Exam Pattern: After 2024, the SAT exam pattern has changed in its digital format. As per the latest update, SAT is now divided into two primary sections: the Reading and Writing section, and the Mathematics section. All questions in the SAT exam are multiple-choice questions (MCQ), with the addition of 11 SPR (Student-Produced Response) type questions. The SAT exam duration is 2 hours and 14 minutes, which includes a 10-minute break in the middle. 

The shift from the traditional once to the new SAT Digital has brought about several notable changes. Subject tests have been eliminated, and essays are no longer part of the SAT for international students. This has resulted in a significant reduction in the overall duration of the SAT Digital exam, nearly shaving off an hour of testing time. The total number of SAT questions has also been reduced.

In the SAT Digital format, candidates have the option to use a basic calculator for answering all Math section questions or utilise the graphic calculator available on the digital platform.

faqs.question: How much does SAT cost in India?
faqs.answer: The SAT exam fees in Indian rupees are 9,320 which includes both the exam fee and the regional fees. Candidates who book the test after the SAT registration deadline have to pay a separate late registration fee of USD 30.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the SAT exam?
faqs.answer: The SAT exam has no specific eligibility criteria in terms of age or educational qualifications. Any candidate 13 years or above is eligible to apply for SAT exam.

faqs.question: When to take the SAT?
faqs.answer: It is suggested to take the SAT during the 11th class. If you are not satisfied with the SAT scores then you will still have time to retake the test in the 12th class.

faqs.question: What are SAT scholarships?
faqs.answer: Students who score more than 1300 in SAT and are from lower income level background can apply for the merit cum need based scholarship offered by the Collgee Board. However, these scholarships are only applicable for Indian students who are planning their studies in Global Alliance member Universities of India.

exam_name: LSAT - Abroad - Law School Admission Test

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
The Law School Admission Test Abroad 2024 or LSAT Abroad 2024 is an exam conducted Globally by the Law School Admission Council or LSAC. The LSAT abroad tests the skills of law school aspirants and their potential to succeed in the first year of law school. The skills tested in the LSAT abroad include reading comprehension, writing, and reasoning. The LSAT abroad exam is meant for students who want to study in the United States, Canada, and other countries for international education in Legal Studies. The LSAT abroad is conducted on fixed predefined dates worldwide at various testing centres. Scores for the LSAT abroad are calculated on a 120 to 180-point scale for each section and the average of these scores or the final LSAT abroad score is also calculated on a scale of 120-140. The scores for the LSAT abroad 2024 will be valid for up to 5 years from the date of the test.

What is LSAT?

LSAT test is conducted for law school admission. The LSAT exam assesses the skills required for law school success: critical reasoning, reading comprehension, and persuasive writing. Law School Admission Council releases LSAT dates. The scores of LSATS are accepted by every ABA-approved law school. 

LSAT abroad testing formats for the 2024 cycle

There are three existing testing formats for the LSAT abroad - the LSAT abroad at test centre, the remote LSAT abroad, and LSAT abroad Writing. Let's talk briefly about all three of these.

LSAT abroad at test centre

As a response to the test takers' feedbacks since 2020, the individuals will now have the option of taking the LSAT exam abroad at a test centre, as offered by the LSAC.

Remote LSAT abroad

The digital, remotely proctored format of the LSAT abroad will continue through the 2023-2024 testing cycle, according to the LSAC.

LSAT abroad Writing

All test takers have to take up the LSAT abroad Writing and this part is administered remotely using secure proctoring software. You can complete LSAT abroad Writing as early as 8 days before the multiple-choice test.

eligibility_criteria.html_content: There are no specific eligibility criteria for a candidate to be eligible to give the LSAT abroad 2024 exam. Instead, candidates are required to meet the individual eligibility criteria of LSAT exam for the prospective college or university of application. Additionally, as the LSAT abroad 2024 is for admission to postgraduate programs in the domain of legal studies, the candidate is generally expected to have completed his or her undergraduate education in related fields.

application_process.html_content:
To apply for the LSAT abroad 2024 exam, candidates are required to have a registered LSAC account.

  • Candidate must create the LSAC account via the official registration link provided.
  • Candidate must fill in the LSAT abroad 2024 application/registration details required to successfully create an account.
  • The candidate can then pick an LSAT abroad 2024 test date and test centre as per the candidate's requirement.
  • During registration, candidates will be asked to give their preference of whether to test at home or at a test centre. However, candidates can make their final decision only after the scheduling option opens for the mode they have indicated.
  • The candidate must pay the registration fee to complete the LSAT abroad application process.

The LSAT 2024 registration fee is USD 222. No additional fee is charged if you change the test date before the deadline of the test you registered for. An additional fee of USD 125 is required for rescheduling the test date or changing the test centre till ten days after the registration deadline. However, the candidate needs to pay the entire registration amount i.e., USD 222 again to make changes in the test date or centre after ten days of the registration deadline and before the test.

preparation_tips.html_content:
For candidates who want to ensure comprehensive preparation for the LSAT abroad 2024 exam, the following preparation tips are to be kept in mind:

  • The candidate should gain a thorough knowledge of the LSAT abroad 2024 syllabus.
  • The candidate should understand the LSAT abroad exam pattern and the types of questions that appear in the exam.
  • The candidate should revise regularly through practice questions and exercises to comprehensively grasp the concepts.
  • The candidate should solve as many mock tests and sample papers as possible in a timed environment to understand what to expect on the test day.
  • The candidate should pinpoint strengths and weaknesses to devise an exam approach and methodology to maximize his or her LSAT abroad score 2024.
  • The candidate should attempt all questions in the LSAT abroad 2024 as there is no negative marking.

admit_card.html_content: The LSAT abroad 2024 admit card or admission ticket is available online using the candidate's LSAC account. The candidates are required to download and print the LSAT abroad 2024 admission ticket and ensure that the photo on the admit card is clear and recent. The candidate is required to carry the admission ticket of LSAT abroad 2024 on the day of the exam along with a valid government-issued photo ID to be allowed entry into the examination hall.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
One of the frequently asked question among candidates is what is on the LSAT? To answer the question, LSAT 2024 exam comprises 5 sections which are each 35 minutes in duration consisting of multiple choice type questions. Of these 5 sections, one section is a variable section that is unscored and doesn't contribute to the candidate's final score. The unscored section cannot be differentiated from the 4 scored sections until the candidate receives his or her score report. Additionally, a 35-minute writing sample is also required. The writing sample is unscored but is sent along with the final scorecard to all the colleges/universities to which the candidate applies. There is no negative marking in any of the sections of the LSAT abroad 2024 exam.

faqs.question: Is there negative marking in the LSAT abroad?
faqs.answer: No, there is no negative marking in the LSAT abroad. Candidates should attempt all the questions.

faqs.question: What are the sections in the LSAT abroad exam?
faqs.answer: There are sections in the LSAT abroad exam:

faqs.question: How many times can I write the LSAT abroad?
faqs.answer: One can appear in LSAT abroad as many times as one wishes as no limit is set.

faqs.question: Is it possible to change the LSAT test date?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is possible to change the test date. Ensure the deadline to change the test date is not over, otherwise you may have to pay an additional fee for this.

faqs.question: Can I choose the time slot to take the LSAT abroad?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is possible to choose your time slot from the available options. However they must make their choice as soon as registration opens because time slots are filled on a first come first served basis.

about_exam.heading: About
about_exam.description:
MCAT Exam 2024: The full form of MCAT is the Medical College Admission Test. MCAT 2024 is an exam conducted for aspiring medical students in the USA, Canada, Australia, and the Caribbean Islands. The MCAT exam is designed to assess the knowledge of students for medical school by testing their knowledge of scientific concepts, critical thinking skills, and ability to apply these concepts to real-world scenarios. 

This MCAT exam 2024 is for prospective MD students who want to pursue medical education in the aforementioned countries and is conducted by the Association of American Medical Colleges or AAMC. There are no MCAT exam dates in India, as MCAT does not have test centers in India. However, one can go to neighboring countries such as Thailand, Malaysia or Singapore to appear for the exam. The nearest MCAT exam dates are April 26 and April 27, 2024.

The MCAT syllabus is designed to test the candidate’s knowledge of physical and biological sciences and his/her verbal reasoning and writing skills. New sections such as psychological, social and biological foundations of behaviour were added to the MCAT exam by the AAMC in 2015. The scores for the MCAT test are valid for only up to 3 years. Some colleges and universities only accept scores up to two years old.

Aspirants looking for MCAT result 2024 should note that the MCAT Score is officially released approximately 30–35 days after an exam date. After completing the MCAT exam, aspiring medical students will receive five scores: one for each of the four test sections and an overall composite score. The scores for each section of the MCAT range from 118 to 132, with the total composite score ranging from 472 to 528.

U.S. Territories which have MCAT  test centres:

  • Guam
  • Puerto Rico
  • US Virgin Islands

International locations for MCAT exam:

Australia, China: Hong Kong, France, Germany, Israel, Japan, Lebanon, Qatar, Singapore, South Africa, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom.

eligibility_criteria.html_content:
A candidate is eligible to give the MCAT exam if he or she is interested in pursuing an educational course in the domain of healthcare and medicine. This includes the following programs:

  • M.D.
  • D.O.
  • Podiatric (D.P.M.)
  • Veterinary Medicine (D.V.M.)
  • Any other healthcare or medicine-related program that requires MCAT scores in order to meet admission criteria. 

Upon registration for the MCAT  test, a candidate is required to submit a statement that verifies the candidate’s interest and intention toward applying to a program in a health professions school. International students who are enrolled in an MBBS program are not required to satisfy any other additional eligibility requirements. 

International candidates who are pursuing a program in healthcare and medicine other than MBBS or have no immediate intention of pursuing a profession in healthcare and medicine are required to obtain special permission in order to be eligible for the MCAT exam. Details for the special permission process are given on the official MCAT web portal on the AAMC website.

application_process.html_content:
In order to apply for the MCAT exam, candidates must complete the registration process online.

  • Candidates must create an Association for American Medical Colleges (AAMC) account via the official registration link on the AAMC web portal.
  • Candidates must fill in all the required details in the application form in order to complete the registration process. Candidates should register at least 60 days prior to the exam in order to ensure a seat in the exam. 
  • Candidates can then select the MCAT test date and preferred test centre for the exam.
  • The final step in the application/registration process is the payment of exam/registration fees which can only be done online.

The standard start time is 8:00 a.m. each day unless otherwise noted below. Scores are released by 5:00 p.m. ET on the scheduled score release date. 

All scheduling deadlines for MCAT Test closes at 11:59 p.m. local test centre time on the day of the deadline.

MCAT Registration Fees

The MCAT test cost varies with the date of registration prior to the exam and is classified into three categories. All the details are mentioned below.

10 days before exam day is the last day to schedule an exam. 

The 10-day deadline is also the last date to reschedule or cancel a reservation and the last date to edit registration information such as name, address, consent, etc.

Exam_Pattern.html_content:
The MCAT exam has a duration of 6 hours and 15 minutes and an overall seated duration of 7 hours and 27 minutes which includes the breaks, optional sections as well and additional questions that are not a part of the actual scored exam. 

The MCAT examination comprises 4 main sections which are-

  • Biological and Biochemical Foundations of Living Systems
  • Chemical and Physical Foundations of Biological Systems
  • Psychological, Social and Biological Foundations of Behavior
  • Critical Analysis and Reasoning Skills
